summary: This document is an Agreed Protective Order filed in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 15-cv-07433). It establishes rules for handling confidential information, specifically to protect sensitive personal information of sexual abuse victims and other confidential materials during discovery. The order was transmitted between attorneys for the parties.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., who is the recipient of the facsimile cover sheet transmitting the Agreed Protective Order.

persons.name: Sigrid S. McCawley
persons.context: Attorney at Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP, who is the sender of the facsimile cover sheet transmitting the Agreed Protective Order and accompanying email.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the civil case (15-cv-07433). The protective order is designed to protect confidential information, including information relating to her and victims of sexual abuse.

connections.description: Attorneys on opposing sides of the case, communicating regarding the transmission of a court document (the Agreed Protective Order).
Implied relationship as McCawley is transmitting a document related to the case where Maxwell is the defendant. The protective order is designed to protect Maxwell's confidential information.
Menninger, as a receiving attorney, is involved in the legal proceedings where Maxwell is the defendant.

events.title: Transmission of Agreed Protective Order
events.description: Attorney Sigrid S. McCawley transmits a facsimile to attorney Laura Menninger containing an Agreed Protective Order and an earlier email.

events.title: Filing of Protective Order
events.description: An Agreed Protective Order is entered in the civil case Ghislaine Maxwell, establishing rules for handling confidential discovery material, including information about sexual abuse victims.

keyFacts: The document is a court-ordered Agreed Protective Order from the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-07433).

The order's primary purpose is to protect confidential information, explicitly including 'sensitive personal information relating to a victim of sexual abuse' and information relating to defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
It outlines strict protocols for designating, sharing, and challenging material marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' among attorneys, parties, experts, witnesses, and the court.
The order permits disclosure of confidential information to law enforcement for investigation purposes.
The transmission shows communication between attorneys Sigrid S. McCawley and Laura Menninger regarding the procedural aspects of the case.
